name: TO_BE_SET
author: Microsoft Corporation
helpMarkDown: Visit our GitHub repository for help on usage for [this task](https://github.com/Microsoft/windows-dev-center-vsts-extension/blob/master/docs/usage.md##windows-store---publish)

inputs.name: serviceEndpoint
inputs.label: Service endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Windows Partner Center endpoint configured with your credentials

inputs.name: appNameType
inputs.label: App identification method
inputs.helpMarkDown: How to determine the app to publish

inputs.name: appId
inputs.label: Application ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: ID of the application, found in the URL for the application's page on the Dev Center

inputs.name: appName
inputs.label: Application primary name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Primary name of the application, found at the top of the application's page on the Dev Center

inputs.name: flightNameType
inputs.label: Flight identification method
inputs.helpMarkDown: How to determine the flight to publish to

inputs.name: flightId
inputs.label: Flight ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: ID of the flight as seen on the Dev Center

inputs.name: flightName
inputs.label: Flight name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the flight as seen on the Dev Center

inputs.name: sandboxId
inputs.label: Sandbox Id
inputs.helpMarkDown: ID of the Sandbox to publish to. This is typically only used by users publishing to XBox

inputs.name: inputMethod
inputs.label: Input Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the method for input. You could choose either selecting a source folder of packages or use a json and zip file. The json and zip are the output of the `Windows Store - Package` task.

inputs.name: jsonPath
inputs.label: JSON Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path to a JSON file that contains the useful information for submission. This JSON is produced by the `Windows Store - Package` task.

inputs.name: zipPath
inputs.label: Zip Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path to a zip file that contains all the packages, images and videos you want to submit. This Zip is produced by the `Windows Store - Package` task.

inputs.name: updateNotesForCertification
inputs.label: Update Notes For Certification
inputs.helpMarkDown: This will change the `notesForCertification` field of the cloned submission to that which is specified in your json. [More info](https://github.com/Microsoft/StoreBroker/blob/v2/Documentation/USAGE.md#the-easy-way)

inputs.name: updatePublishModeAndVisibility
inputs.label: Update Publish Mode And Visibility
inputs.helpMarkDown: This will change the `targetPublishMode`, `targetPublishDate`, and `visibility` of the cloned submission to that which is specified in your json. Without doing this, keep in mind that your new submission will publish the same way as your previous submission (be that immediately, manual or time based). [More info](https://github.com/Microsoft/StoreBroker/blob/v2/Documentation/USAGE.md#the-easy-way)

inputs.name: updatePricingAndAvailability
inputs.label: Update Pricing And Availability
inputs.helpMarkDown: This will change the `pricing`, `allowTargetFutureDeviceFamilies`, `allowMicrosoftDecideAppAvailabilityToFutureDeviceFamilies`, and `enterpriseLicensing` of the cloned submission to that which is specified in your json. [More info](https://github.com/Microsoft/StoreBroker/blob/v2/Documentation/USAGE.md#the-easy-way)

inputs.name: updateAppProperties
inputs.label: Update App Properties
inputs.helpMarkDown: This will change the `applicationCategory`, `hardwarePreferences`, `hasExternalInAppProducts`, `meetAccessibilityGuidelines`, `canInstallOnRemovableMedia`, `automaticBackupEnabled`, and `isGameDvrEnabled` of the cloned submission to that which is specified in your json. [More info](https://github.com/Microsoft/StoreBroker/blob/v2/Documentation/USAGE.md#the-easy-way)

inputs.name: updateGamingOptions
inputs.label: Update Gaming Options
inputs.helpMarkDown: This will update all values under the `gamingOptions` node specified in your json. [More info](https://github.com/Microsoft/StoreBroker/blob/v2/Documentation/USAGE.md#the-easy-way)

inputs.name: jsonZipUpdateMetadata
inputs.label: Update Metadata
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether this submission should update metadata

inputs.name: sourceFolder
inputs.label: Source Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder of the packages that the publishing task consume

inputs.name: contents
inputs.label: Contents
inputs.helpMarkDown: App packages that are part of the submission. Provide the relative path of the packages with respect to the source folder. For Sparse Bundles the format is <AppId>:<PackagePath> (e.g. XYZ123:$(Agent.WorkFolder)/*/*.appxbundle), specifying the AppId and Package Path (one path per line). Minimatch pattern is supported.

inputs.name: force
inputs.label: Delete pending submission
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to delete an existing submission instead of failing the task

inputs.name: isSparseBundle
inputs.label: Sparse Bundle
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether the app is a sparse bundle or not.

inputs.name: metadataUpdateMethod
inputs.label: Metadata update method
inputs.visibleRule: releaseTrack = Production && inputMethod = Packages && isSparseBundle = False

inputs.name: metadataPath
inputs.label: Metadata root folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to a directory containing the metadata. Consult the documentation for the expected format.

inputs.name: updateText
inputs.label: Update Text Listing
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether text listing should be updated.

inputs.name: updateImages
inputs.label: Update Images
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether images should also be updated. **Warning**: if you check this box, all the old images of the listings you provide will be deleted.

inputs.name: updateVideos
inputs.label: Update Videos
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether videos should also be updated. **Warning**: if you check this box, all the old videos of the listings you provide will be deleted.

inputs.name: minimumMetadata
inputs.label: Update only specified metadata
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is checked, the task will update only the metadata attributes provided. This will not delete any missing attributes, like languages. [More info](https://github.com/Microsoft/windows-dev-center-vsts-extension/blob/master/README.md)

inputs.name: createRollout
inputs.label: Create Rollout
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create a rollout as part of this submission. If checked, the udpates on this submission will be delivered only to a percentage of customers in the production/flight group.

inputs.name: rollout
inputs.label: Rollout Percentage
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the rollout percentage value. Valid values [0.0-100.0) zero included, one hundred excluded

inputs.name: existingPackageRolloutAction
inputs.label: Existing Package Rollout Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this parameter to specify what should be done if there is a published submission currently in the process of a package rollout. You can choose to complete or rollback the rollout

inputs.name: isSeekEnabled
inputs.label: Enable Rollout Seek
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether you want to enable Seek in the rollout.

inputs.name: skipPolling
inputs.label: Skip polling
inputs.helpMarkDown: Skip polling submission after committing it to Dev Center. **Warning**: if you check this box, you will not see errors, if any, that your submission may run into. You will have to manually check status of your submission in Dev Center.

inputs.name: deletePackages
inputs.label: Delete Packages
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete old redundant packages from the production/flight group.

inputs.name: numberOfPackagesToKeep
inputs.label: Number of Packages to keep
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of packages to keep per unique Target Device Family and Target Platform.

inputs.name: targetPublishMode
inputs.label: Target Publish Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates how the submission should be published. Default will use the same option the previous submission used. These options map those in the Publishing hold options in the store. Fore more information, see [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/uwp/publish/manage-submission-options#publishing-hold-options). Setting this to any value other than Default will override the checkbox `Update Publish Mode And Visibility`. [More info](https://github.com/Microsoft/StoreBroker/blob/v2/Documentation/USAGE.md#the-easy-way).

inputs.name: targetPublishDate
inputs.label: Target Publish Date
inputs.helpMarkDown: The specific date/time that the submission should be published. Using this value will override any value that might have been set by checkbox `Update Publish Mode And Visibility`. Users should provide this in local time and it will be converted automatically to UTC (e.g. 01/30/2019 00:00:00). [More info](https://github.com/Microsoft/StoreBroker/blob/v2/Documentation/USAGE.md#the-easy-way).

inputs.name: Visibility
inputs.label: Visibility
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates the store visibility of the app once the submission has been published. Setting this to any value other than `Default` will override the checkbox `Update Publish Mode And Visibility`. [More info](https://github.com/Microsoft/StoreBroker/blob/v2/Documentation/USAGE.md#the-easy-way).

inputs.name: isMandatoryUpdate
inputs.label: Mandatory Update
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether you want to treat the packages in this submission as mandatory for self-installing app updates.

inputs.name: mandatoryUpdateDifferHours
inputs.label: The number of hours until packages become mandatory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The effective time when the packages in this submission become mandatory, in hours from submission time.

inputs.name: preserveSubmissionId
inputs.label: Preserve Submission ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: This task will always preserve the Id of the new submission for future tasks in the same job to consume. By checking this, the task will also preserve the ID at the release level. This could be useful on auto-retry scenarios. [More info](https://github.com/Microsoft/windows-dev-center-vsts-extension/blob/master/README.md)

inputs.name: logPath
inputs.label: Log Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The full path for the Store Broker log file

inputs.name: disableTelemetry
inputs.label: Disable Telemetry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to disable or not the collection of data. See Microsoft's [Privacy Policy](https://privacy.microsoft.com/en-US/privacystatement) and [Terms of Use](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/legal/intellectualproperty/copyright/default.aspx). For specific information on Store Broker's telemetry, see [Store Broker Telemetry](https://github.com/Microsoft/StoreBroker/blob/v2/Documentation/USAGE.md#telemetry)

OutputVariables.name: WS_SubmissionId
OutputVariables.description: The submission Id of the most recent submission created by this task.
